'''This data filter simply adds the time given in param ``endtime`` to the

indication and can be used to signal the bar is passed the end of the

The default value for ``endtime`` is 1 second before midnight 23:59:59

This might not be the best place to ask, but I'm unable to post on the backtrader community forum and I figured some of you may have some experience in backtrader.

Anyways, I can't seem to figure out how to cancel a stop loss order that was created alongside a short entry. I wan't to cancel the stop order when my target is hit(I cannot use bracket orders since the short target is not a price target but an RSI level target). I'm still very new to OOP + coding in general and can't find anything online or even the backtrader docs.

This is my code so far, I'm getting this error "AttributeError: 'int' object has no attribute 'ref' "

I gave up on figuring it out by myself, so any help would be very appreciated.

I have a Problem with the logic of backtrader. My strategy uses daily close prices to trade. At time t the Signals are generated, the orders shall be executed at the close t+1. So far so good.

The Problem is that if my allocation to assets change, backtrader executes the sell order at time t+1 but cannot execute the buy order at the same time because it doesnt has enough Cash. Margin call!

I have read that the logic of backtrader is that the order is not executed before the next Bar. So a rebalance at the same time is not possible? Is there a way to circumvent this Problem?

My next try is to execute sell orders at the open and the buy orders at the close at t+1.

Any other ideas? Thank you

Edit: Logic of my nextr try
